p: Aluminum chloride treated animals showed a significant increase in MDA level ( p < 0.001) and significant decrease in level of GSH ( p < 0.01), SOD ( p < 0.01) and catalase activity ( p < 0.01) in hippocampus when compared with normal control animals. MDA level was significantly reduced in cardamom oil treatment at a dose of 100 and 200 mg/kg ( p < 0.001) when compared with the disease control group. Cardamom oil treatment showed significant improvement in GSH and SOD levels at a dose of 200 mg/kg ( p < 0.01) as compared with disease control group. Treatment with cardamom oil at a dose of 200 mg/kg ( p < 0.05) significantly improved catalase activity as compared with disease control group ( Table 2).
